channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The government is shut down but Trump’s social media feed is working overtime
item.description: The stream of invective and trolling has been remarkable even for a 79-year-old president who is as chronically online as any member of Gen Z.

item.title: Sam Altman on AI bubble: ‘People make some dumb capital allocations’ from time to time
item.description: “People will overinvest and lose money, and underinvest and lose a lot of revenue,” Altman said while touring a huge new data center in Texas.

item.title: Paul Hastings partners: Key takeaways for public companies facing short-seller reports
item.description: How to contain market drops, shareholder litigation and reputational damage.

item.title: Parents sue Tesla after their 19-year-old daughter died in her Cybertruck, alleging faulty door design made it impossible to escape the burning car
item.description: Krysta Tsukahara survived the initial crash, but power failure to the electronic doors prevented would-be rescuers from saving her.

item.title: Patricia Routledge, Hoity-Toity Housewife of ‘Keeping Up Appearances,’ Dies at 96
item.description: Before she became known as the snooty suburbanite Hyacinth Bucket, Ms. Routledge was an acclaimed stage performer, appearing with the Royal Shakespear...

item.title: Mysterious drones that officials can’t explain keep shutting down Europe’s airports: ‘it could be anybody’
item.description: It could be everyone from kids "fooling around" or state actors, experts say.

item.title: Trump Administration Reverses $187 Million in N.Y. Counterterrorism Cuts
item.description: Gov. Kathy Hochul had described the cuts, which would have devastated New York’s intelligence and counterterrorism operations, as “utterly shocking.”

item.title: Ukraine’s New Prime Minister Is a Woman Who Speaks Trump’s Language
item.description: The appointment of Yuliia Svyrydenko, a business-oriented official, shows how Kyiv is trying to persuade the Trump administration that working with th...

item.title: French Prime Minister Vows to Let Parliament Decide on Budget Bill
item.description: Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu ruled out using a constitutional tool that would avoid a full parliamentary vote, hoping for compromise among divided...

item.title: Police Accidentally Shot and Killed a Victim During Manchester Terrorist Attack
item.description: Officials said one of the men killed at the Heaton Park Congregation synagogue in northwestern England had been hit by police gunfire.

item.title: French Prime Minister Vows to Let Parliament Decide on Budget Bill
item.description: Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu ruled out using a constitutional tool that would avoid a full parliamentary vote, hoping for compromise among divided...

item.title: How an Attack on a Synagogue in Manchester Unfolded
item.description: A congregant in Manchester, England, described how fellow worshipers, including the rabbi, used their bodies to barricade the entrance as the assailan...

item.title: Indian Comedian Kunal Kamra Forced Offstage Amid Political Censorship
item.description: The Indian comedian Kunal Kamra was forced offstage after a political joke led to a mob attack. Unlike Jimmy Kimmel, he is unlikely to return anytime ...

item.title: How Video Games Are Shaping a Generation of Boys, for Better and Worse
item.description: In the last decade and a half, boys and young men have more than doubled their average time per week spent gaming.
